{"step_by_step_thinking": "The volume of distribution (Vd) is a pharmacokinetic parameter that indicates how a drug distributes in the body. A low Vd means that the drug tends to stay in the plasma and does not distribute extensively into tissues. This is supported by Document [15] which states that a drug with a low Vd has a propensity to remain in the plasma.", "answer_choice": "D. Drug is not extensively distribution to tissue"}
